name: Population in countries where same-sex marriage is legal
descriptionShort: Same-sex marriage is marriage and marriage recognition between two people of the same biological sex or gender identity.
descriptionProcessing:
We converted the original data with the years of the legalization of same-sex marriage into a expanded dataset with the legal status of same-sex marriage for each country and year.

We estimated regional aggregations of these status by using [Our World in Data definitions of regions](https://ourworldindata.org/world-region-map-definitions) and our [consolidated population data](https://ourworldindata.org/population-sources).
datasetName: Same-sex marriage around the world - Pew Research Center

presentation.titlePublic: Population in countries where same-sex marriage is legal

descriptionKey: The data is up to date as of June 2025.

origins.title: Same-sex marriage around the world - Pew Research Center
origins.description:
Since the first same-sex marriages were legally recognized in the Netherlands in 2001, nearly 40 other jurisdictions – mostly in Europe and the Americas – have enacted laws allowing gay and lesbian couples to marry. This year, Thailand and Liechtenstein join the list.

Use the interactive table below to sort the places allowing same-sex marriages by name, region and the year legal same-sex marriage took effect. The table also includes some key facts about the process in each jurisdiction.

origins.description:
Our World in Data builds and maintains a long-run dataset on population by country, region, and for the world, based on various sources.

You can find more information on these sources and how our time series is constructed on this page: https://ourworldindata.org/population-sources
